title: arabspaceship123
author: arabspaceship123
created_time: August 14, 2023, 10:12:48 AMLast edit: August 15, 2023, 09:38:25 AM by arabspaceship123
content: It's now 15 hours he's created his forum user account btcchamp88. In the time he's opened threads saying he's new to bitcoin. He's put Jambler Mixer Website in his user profile so he can't be new to bitcoin.He doesn't reply when he's receiving help. He's opening new threads asking silly questions. He isn't the only user doing this. Is it an example of creating accounts by ppl who want trust or merits?  Quote from: btcchamp88 on August 13, 2023, 08:05:55 PMhey i am beginner with btc Can someone explain how to send money from a debit card to a Bitcoin address without having to create a Bitcoin wallet? What is the easiest and quickest way to do this? Sending Money From a Debit Card to a Bitcoin AddressAugust 13, 2023, 08:05:55 PM24 user replies0 OP repliesQuote from: btcchamp88 on August 13, 2023, 08:36:16 PMneed helpHello room, I ve been having issues with my bitcoin bought from bitcoin.com and sent to my wallet it has been unconfirmed for 6 days now. Please can anyone help out on what can be done?sry im new in paying with btcunconfirmed bitcoin transactionAugust 13, 2023, 08:36:16 PM9 user replies0 OP repliesQuote from: btcchamp88 on August 14, 2023, 09:19:29 AMAre there any limits on how many times you can buy/sell crypto on Coin base every day?coinbase limits buy/sell?Today at 09:19:29 AM9 user replies0 OP repliesQuote from: btcchamp88 on August 14, 2023, 09:47:58 AMhello i heard cryptopay start a new card program is this true? but its only available as app not as desktop website, why? anyone have information about it?Visa BITCOIN cards in Europe cryptopayToday at 09:47:58 AM0 user replies0 OP repliesQuote from: btcchamp88 on August 14, 2023, 04:46:32 PMIs there any website with a short and good introduction to bitcoin, wallet, buy, trade, mining, invest, earn...?Quote from: btcchamp88 on August 14, 2023, 07:58:26 PMhey im new, what is the difference between bitcoin and bitcoin cash? can anyone explain in short words?It's his only reply to a postQuote from: btcchamp88 on August 14, 2023, 08:11:27 PMsry my life is not 24/7 online like some others life, you have to forgive me. also have to wait 360sec for reply. i have other things to do then only waiting to be able to reply in minutes. but i think that was not my question.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Maybe he is a shill for jambler? His threads aren't really getting much attention and he isn't asking for merits or trust. Just looks like he is spamming the forum.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on August 14, 2023, 10:19:37 AMMaybe he is a shill for jambler? His threads aren't really getting much attention and he isn't asking for merits or trust. Just looks like he is spamming the forum. That's the most likely scenario. Backlinks and references from Bitcointalk are always welcome to boost the website. By opening specific topics, he is just trying to get to the meter in order to be able to put a link in his signature.Later, such accounts are always valuable to bounty spammers.

comments.author: arabspaceship123
comments.body: He's asking random questions so doesn't look like a meaning behind what he's doing. One of the threads managed 24 replies so he's got attention. If he's put Jambler in his profile it's like he's a shill it's looking that way. Quote from: yahoo62278 on August 14, 2023, 10:19:37 AMMaybe he is a shill for jambler? His threads aren't really getting much attention and he isn't asking for merits or trust. Just looks like he is spamming the forum.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: From the response I have read, I had to check for myself. I saw the [banned mixer] web link on OP profile and I went further to find out the mixer has been existing for a very long time and their presence is recognized here.While still on it, I discovered that there was a complaints by  a staff legendary member here which there has not been any response on the thread since then till now. Possibly, if OP could have [banned mixer] mixer on profile then I believe OP is not a newbie here possibly OP might be shilling for them so as to revive their presence here but I do not think that is the best way for them to start again If they truly want to return. They should use their announcement thread to start up their communication with the platform members and if they don't have access to their previous account or maybe the account holder is not in terms with them, they should come up plane by letting the community know about it to gain trust back and also resolving any pending issues they had then.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on August 14, 2023, 10:19:37 AMMaybe he is a shill for jambler? His threads aren't really getting much attention and he isn't asking for merits or trust. Just looks like he is spamming the forum. If that's the case, the mods need to shut his ass down before he really goes to work spamming all of his nonsense.If those questions were legitimate, you'd think there would be somewhat of a back-and-forth between him and the members who are trying to answer them.  Creating a thread and then just disappearing is typical behavior from newbies on bitcointalk, but this guy has multiple requests for help on very specific issues.  If nothing else, he ought to be following up if a suggestion works or if he's still having problems.But I don't think his questions are legit, nor do I think he's a newcomer to bitcoin just based on stuff he's asking and the mixer it looks like he's trying to shill for.  Good catch on this one, OP.

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on August 14, 2023, 10:19:37 AMMaybe he is a shill for jambler? His threads aren't really getting much attention and he isn't asking for merits or trust. Just looks like he is spamming the forum. This is only reason we can expect from his behaviors because his posts is not worthy to recieve merit. Most of his posts are related to Bitcoin discussion which making more clear that this user wanted to shill Jambler mixer.Op did a great job and I will recommend keep an eye on this user. It will be interesting to see which signature he wear after become Junior member. If he promote in signature then it will be clear 100% that he is promoter of mixer. So far we can only make expectations from his behaviors and profile backlink .

comments.author: God Of Thunder
comments.body: This is not the first time I am seeing newbie accounts or member accounts create threads and ask questions about random things and they never come back to their thread. I am too bored with them, and this is why I remember their names too. Here is a small list of their usernames.Godlovesyou Created 68 threads, and replied only 36 times in those 68 threads. This user received a tag for plagiarism.Quote from: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=3538401 lovesmayfamilis    2023-05-17    Reference    Two cases of plagiarismJamesDaniel90 Created 103 threads out of his 434 posts. He received neutral tags for posting useless shit.Quote from: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=3486215 decodx    2023-01-20    Reference    Spamming of forum with identical topics and questions. He constantly recycles the same sentences with only a slightly changed arrangement. Check post history.Quote from: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=trust;u=3486215 Mbitr    2023-05-23    Reference    Spamming and regurgitating the same topics (check post history) .JamesBorn Created 71 threads out of his 121 posts. Current status is Banned.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: I sometimes get fed up with the attitude of some newbie who try to create a thread and ask the community - but at the same time they don't proactively help their thread contributors by responding to a reply or two. This is a bit far-fetched - but some beginners actually do it.I'm not sure if they really need help - but her attitude doesn't reflect that. But OP - if the thread is unimportant and you see it as spam, then report it.

His threads aren't really getting much attention and he isn't asking for merits or trust. Just looks like he is spamming the forum. If that's the case, the mods need to shut his ass down before he really goes to work spamming all of his nonsense.If users report the threads he's opened he'll be stopped. Mods wouldn't encourage spamming.Quote from: The Sceptical Chymist on August 14, 2023, 11:35:26 AMIf those questions were legitimate, you'd think there would be somewhat of a back-and-forth between him and the members who are trying to answer them.  Creating a thread and then just disappearing is typical behavior from newbies on bitcointalk, but this guy has multiple requests for help on very specific issues.  If nothing else, he ought to be following up if a suggestion works or if he's still having problems.I'm convinced there isn't any thing legitimate. Disappearing after asking questions isn't new I've seen users do it. He isn't following up suggestions saying they've worked or any thing else. btcchamp88 doesn't want to talk he wants to start threads.Quote from: The Sceptical Chymist on August 14, 2023, 11:35:26 AMBut I don't think his questions are legit, nor do I think he's a newcomer to bitcoin just based on stuff he's asking and the mixer it looks like he's trying to shill for.  Good catch on this one, OP.He's using Jambler's Mixer in his profile so he isn't honest he isn't a newcomer to bitcoin or the forum. His questions aren't legit.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: CryptSafe on August 14, 2023, 11:07:26 AMFrom the response I have read, I had to check for myself. I saw the [banned mixer] web link on OP profile and I went further to find out the mixer has been existing for a very long time and their presence is recognized here.While still on it, I discovered that there was a complaints by  a staff legendary member here which there has not been any response on the thread since then till now. Possibly, if OP could have [banned mixer] mixer on profile then I believe OP is not a newbie here possibly OP might be shilling for them so as to revive their presence here but I do not think that is the best way for them to start again If they truly want to return. He has a jambler dot ORG link!Although the website is basically a whitelabel clone it's not the original.I don't know how genuine the clone is and if he's doing this just to promote his legit website or he is trying to scam someone but it's obvious he's not from the team and the way he's acting is beyond suspicious.As for the multiple topics, I have a feeling we're going to see edits and links added pretty soon on those OP, that is unless he gets banned!

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: There are some users I think we don't need to waste all our efforts in giving them attention haven known they are spammer because from what you showed above is a good example of someone spamming. At first when creating a topic he should stick over there to see the response of people and follow them serially on what they are saying, even though he would create another topic that doesn't mean he would create similar topic and post and again how did he got to know about withdrawal since he said he is a beginner and knows nothing to bitcoin. Does this shows he instantly learned and got to know everything before going to bitcoin.com to make his withdrawal. Sometimes it weird me seeing people not being serious with their post and how they manages to create post over here. Such posters doesn't deserves any merits better still he could be added on ignore list to stop seeing his post.

I've seen users say the same about newbies editing OP's adding links. It's a process of their spamming.He's increased his posts to 7 so I've updated my OP. comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: QuoteWhat's wrong with btcchamp88. Some newbies behave so strange. Maybe it's strange to you, but it's nothing new and honestly it doesn't deserve to be discussed as a special problem that this forum has. What every user of the forum can do is to report such topics to moderators if he thinks there are grounds for it (low value topic, thread spam, using AI or plagiarism...) or simply abstain and not participate in such discussions.It is not surprising that some people come to this forum for completely different reasons than because they are interested in Bitcoin or any meaningful discussion. Fortunately, most people quickly realize that such a method of communication does not produce any results, so they will either give up or receive a permanent ban.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: This behavior has become very common in the forum. This is normal because the forum is the largest and oldest community of Bitcoin and Crypto, and everyone is interested in promoting their services in the most important forum.Many newbie accounts are registered on the forum with the aim of promoting a specific service later. Personally, I do not see a problem if the account adheres to the rules of the forum and tries to gain the trust of the community in a legal and honorable way. The problem lies in those scammers who are only interested in spreading any nonsense to reach their goal in illegal ways. These should be reported immediately and the forum cleaned of them.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: After replying on one of that user's threads and checked its profile after seeing another thread made by him, i observed that he really is just trying to spam with general questions without even replying to the replies.But after OP shows him this thread he then replied to some of the threads he created. Lol

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: The rate newbies are popping up to post less quality posts is alarming as well, but i want to believe there are personal and hidden agenda for doing that, they may not spelt them out but we know their likes and what they are up to, any low quality newbie posters wil hardly see that opportunity to rank up or be recognized because they are more of trollers or spammers, they would have forgotten their actions are working already against what they have posted.

LolHe's posted 3 replies + 6 OP's posts since he's opened his account 48 hours ago. We don't know why he's behaving so strange but it's suspicious. It isn't normal.The Jambler site's registered in his profile so it's obvious he isn't new. If he's recognised his account became under observation he'll put a temp hold on spam.Thanks I'm locking the thread because it's presented the info about btcchamp88.

comments.author: arabspaceship123
comments.body: It's unlocked to add a link. He's learning fast because after 10 days he's registered he said he was new to bitcoin. Now he's selling bitcoin ponzi scripts & programming bitcoin mixers. Don't believe him don't buy from btcchamp88 anyone interested in own tor website bitcoin project?

comments.author: JoyMarsha
comments.body: This particular conduct of "spamming the entire forum and pretending not to know anything about bitcoin" is committed by many newbies in an effort to attract attention. Watch in a few days to come, if not disappeared from the forum you will find him dishing out advice to other newbies on what to do or not to do about bitcoin. By then he would have forgotten that days back he was clueless about bitcoin.
